title: _act_
author: _act_
content: Ads are dangerous, it can be used by hackers and scammers. It is better to avoid ads completely, do not click on any ad and be using ad blockers. This has been what we have discussed before on this forum several times, but if some people are not yet victims, they will not learn. See data on how some people have lost money because of google ads:Google Ads data: $4M stolen through crypto phishing URLsQuoteData from Google Ads coupled with blockchain analytics reveals that over $4 million has been stolen from users that have fallen for malicious phishing websites promoted on Google.Avoid all types of ads.

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: Not just adverts make sure to avoid malware’s, unnecessary sites, there are dangers everywhere in the internet and it’s really hard to avoid them.A good way of staying safe is using the device that has your Bitcoin wallet safely, you are better off having an offline wallet. You can learn how to create your own cold wallet storage and more about it here.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5237614.msg54149363#msg54149363It’s really helpful because your wallet are safest offline.

comments.author: Crypt0Gore
comments.body: The moment you visit a new website there is a chance that the website will display Ads and you won't be able to control anything unless you close the tab, some websites are this annoying.There is no way you will browse on your PC and Ads won't do their thing, the solution is using an Ad-blocker.I can't lose my crypto to scammers through my PC because I don't run any crypto wallet software on my PC, I believe doing this is automatically not safe, it is way easier to get into a trap while browsing on your PC than anywhere else.Use an Ad blocker, get browser plug-ins from official websites, get an antivirus running, and be careful visiting any websites.

comments.author: Merit.s
comments.body: We should be careful of ads that we see on our phones or laptops and not to click on them thinking that it is a legit platform. Malware is another way in which scammers use in phishing. It has always been an advise here on the forum on ignoring whatever kind of link you see while making use of the internet because you never can tell who is a scammer until you have been scammed. These are one of the reasons why we should be active on the forum to listen to advice and get information that will protect our privacy and keep our investment safe. An Ad blocker will keep you safe from these scammers.Thanks OP, for a reminder.

comments.author: Churchillvv
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on April 27, 2023, 10:17:22 AMAds are dangerous, it can be used by hackers and scammers. It is better to avoid ads completely. I don't think it's feasible to totally eliminate advertisements... Nearly all applications have advertisements, and the worst part is that even if you pay for a premium version to remove them, they will still appear. That is so f**king annoying. There is a specific kind of advertising fraud called "Click Spamming/Click Flooding" that is exceedingly difficult to resist.This variation targets mobile websites and applications particularly. The website or app conducts clicks in the background while continuing to function properly for the user. Because they never saw it, users are never even aware that they interacted with in-app advertisements.Another is known as domain spoofing.Fraudsters typically utilize this form of to pretend to be a high-value domain that is more valuable and more an asset. Although the user and impressions are genuine, the money invested on the subpar website is not justified. Cross-Domain Embedding, Custom Browsers, and Human Browsers are a few examples of domain spoofing. Examples of this scam include websites like Amazon that have been cloned; it will be difficult to detect this because when you buy goods, they will never be delivered, and Metamask is another example of website that can be cloned, when cloned it vanishes after you enter your log-in information.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Google ads were meant for advertisement purposes and were a faster way to reach out to people. These days, Google ad's are becoming so annoying, they just don't care if they show you something or not.With or without ad blocker, we can all avoid falling victim to all this phishing scam. Most of these ads are active on sites that we visit; not all sites support ads, but we can avoid those that do.One thing is for the ads to open; another thing is for one to be foolish enough to be tempted by whatever the ads show him or her that will make them dive in. In one way or another, it's users that actually authorize those ads to gain access to their devices, or they second-handly give authorization to some sites they bump into from the ads because of the tempting offers they see on them.Google itself is just out there to make money; they don't actually care what advertiser paid them to advertise; they just integrate and post whatever anyone willing to pay gives them. If not, ordinarily, some scam link can easily be identified by the Google team and stopped from ever being posted.

comments.author: coupable
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on April 27, 2023, 10:17:22 AMAvoid all types of ads.Unfortunately, this is almost impossible today, unless I stop using the Internet completely. Or let's say that this is no longer possible today with the increasing demand for Internet use and the launch of various applications. Ad blocking applications such as adblock may be highly secure, but they cannot stop all types of advertising, since some of them may appear in a form affiliated with the original content of the site, or the site will not work until after disabling adblock. Literally, it is not possible to stop the movement of ads on various media, because most of the benefits come mainly from ads, without which these applications would not have existed in the first place.The best advice is to encourage the use of adblock since it works fairly often and to avoid clicking on any of the links shown by the ads.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Yeah, google search ads are infested with scams. Thankfully, ublock origin does a good job at omitting them from my search results. I use it on my PC and android phone - firefox, I suggest those who haven't tried it to give it a try, see: https://github.com/gorhill/uBlock. Alternatively, there's also duckduckgo - search engine without ads.Note: this doesn't mean that you should go around trusting whatever is in your first search result as I'm only talking about omitting ads on search results.

comments.author: Ultegra134
comments.body: Quote from: Crypt0Gore on April 27, 2023, 11:14:14 AMThe moment you visit a new website there is a chance that the website will display Ads and you won't be able to control anything unless you close the tab, some websites are this annoying.There is no way you will browse on your PC and Ads won't do their thing, the solution is using an Ad-blocker.I can't lose my crypto to scammers through my PC because I don't run any crypto wallet software on my PC, I believe doing this is automatically not safe, it is way easier to get into a trap while browsing on your PC than anywhere else.Use an Ad blocker, get browser plug-ins from official websites, get an antivirus running, and be careful visiting any websites. Adblock works for pop-up ads, banners, video ads on YouTube, etc. These ads, which the OP is mentioning and another user pointed out with photos, appear on top of Google's organic results, and you can be easily tricked into thinking that you're clicking on the right website, but you're not. I highly doubt that adblock is effective at filtering these advertisements. Unfortunately, in the case of cryptocurrencies, these malicious advertisements are extremely common, and the only way to avoid them is by being careful enough.The issue lies with Google, which isn't doing any serious background checks; these websites are constantly taken down and restarted with a different name and domain.
